definition: to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)
to inspect/to review/to read/to peruse/to go through/to experience

sentences.english: But there are restrictions, of course.
sentences.chinese: 当然，这种借阅是有一些限制的。

sentences.english: Paula Baxter says people still come to the library to borrow books and movies. But now they can also download e-books.
sentences.chinese: 保巴克斯特说，人们还是来图书馆借阅书籍和电影。

sentences.english: The videos and CDs in this room can be borrowed.
sentences.chinese: 您可以借阅本室的视听资料。

sentences.english: E-book borrowing had typically been rising 10% or 15% a month, he said.
sentences.chinese: 他说，电子书借阅以前一般每月增长10%或15%。

sentences.english: Open-shelf-borrowing brings new requirements to the humanization construction in circulation department in library.
sentences.chinese: 开架借阅给流通部的人性化建设带来了新的要求。

sentences.english: He says the debate over e-book lending will likely end up in court.
sentences.chinese: 他说，对电子图书借阅的辩论可能会在法庭上。

sentences.english: You have broken the library rules, so your application card will be forfeited for a month.
sentences.chinese: 您违反了图书馆的规定，所以借阅证将被没收一个月。

sentences.english: Withe-books, we don't have to go to the library to borrow or go to the bookstore to buy.
sentences.chinese: 有了电子书，我们不用去图书馆借阅或去书店买。

sentences.english: Firstly, why not arrange an inquiry desk at the circulation hall?
sentences.chinese: 首先，为什么不在借阅大厅安排一个咨询台呢？

sentences.english: Please put your card on the POS.
Nobody is entitled to borrow the book indefinitely.
sentences.chinese: 没有人可以无限期地借阅这本书。

sentences.english: The exercise of open-shelf book borrowing marks the developmental orientation of library service.
sentences.chinese: 图书开架借阅是图书馆服务工作的发展方向。

sentences.english: Nobody has the right to borrow the book indefinitely.
sentences.chinese: 任何人都没有权利无限期地借阅这本书。

sentences.english: Only one person at a time will be allowed to check out a digital copy of an in-copyright book for two weeks.
sentences.chinese: 一人一次只能借阅一本图书的电子版，借阅期为两周。

sentences.english: Only one person at a time will be allowed to check out a digital copy of an in-copyright book for two weeks.
sentences.chinese: 一人一次只能借阅一本图书的电子版，借阅期为两周。

definition: books (in a library or bookstore)/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]
a store room for books/fig. an erudite person/the Bibliotheca and Epitome of pseudo-Apollodorus
teashop with performance by 評書|评书 story tellers/(attached to name of publishing houses)/(in former times) private school/library (of classic texts)
to lend (sth other than money)/to borrow
